column1: Computational Neuroscience, Cognition and AI MSc
column5: This unique interdisciplinary course combines aspects of psychology, mathematics and computer science. It uses artificial intelligence to further the understanding of the brain.You will learn how:the brain is believed to work on the cellular, network and systems levelto develop mathematical models of brain function and use them in simulationscognitive phenomena relate to brain activitycurrent AI algorithms are based on neuroscience findingsa range of experimental approaches are used to measure and analyse brain function.There will be particular focus on how:
column7: Please see the university website for further information on fees for this course.
